[hardware - projects - mitxela.com](https://mitxela.com/projects/hardware)

FF's TTS is an important project for anyone who wants a trivial to use text-to-speech system. It's built into the browser so you can just run

wss = window.speechSynthesis;
    for (let i = 0; i < wss.getVoices().length; ++i){
      str = `Voice ${i} is ${wss.getVoices()[i].name}`;
      s = new SpeechSynthesisUtterance(str);
      s.voice = wss.getVoices()[i];
      wss.speak(s);
      console.log(str);
    }

 in the console to get various TTS examples. For some browsers, this can be done offline while others use a cloud based TTS system.

# Misc links

Ich finde immer wieder nette Links und versuche ab jetzt die mal etwas zu kuratieren.

## Software 

### Cloud

- **Athens** https://github.com/athensresearch/athens Open source knowledge base. Maybe a Notion alternative. Interesting for **digital-vereint**
- **Baserow** https://baserow.io/ An open source no-code DB manager. Maybe interesting for **BerlinAPI**

### Apps

- **Textbuddy** https://textbuddy.app/ is a Mac app for manipulating text. A Swiss Army knife for plain text that is there when you need it and hidden when you don’t. Faster than your IDE. Easier than the command line. Interesting for daily writing business.

### Libraries

- **Classnames** https://www.npmjs.com/package/classnames JS Package for combining classnames in React. Relevant for tailwind and the dev team

### VSCode

- Wallabyjs https://wallabyjs.com/ Run tests while you are writing your code in VSCode. Wallaby has a free for open source plan!

### Shell

- **Bit** https://github.com/chriswalz/bit is an experimental modernized git CLI built on top of git that provides happy defaults and other niceties.
- **pgcli** https://www.pgcli.com/**  is a command line interface for Postgres with auto-completion and syntax highlighting.

## Tutorials

- **Debug anything: The basics** https://charlesagile.com/debug-series-pnodejs-browser-javascript
